Text.Page: Fraya, the new incarnation of the Core, returned to Allemantheia and used her power to track down Akasha. You and Elleon went to Fyrmount to break into Akasha's Hideout and confront her.

Dear ,

We saved the Core, but Akasha and Thulsa won't stop until Allemantheia is in ruins.

Fraya says that Thulsa is hiding, but Akasha is still in Fyrmount. I'd love to cut her throat, but that last fight took a lot out of me.

I need your help. Once more unto the breach! Let's end Akasha's threat.

Meet me at the Shurian Reserve Camp, Fyrmount.

—Elleon.

Fraya says Akasha's Hideout is deep underground. And guess who found the teleportal to take us there? Please, please...no need to salute. Prostration will suffice. Ha!

One other thing: there have been lots of kidnappings in the last few days. Whatever Akasha is up to, it must require sacrificial victims."What are we waiting for?"

Indeed. No point in giving her time to plan another escape, eh?

Take the path on the right to the {@LinkCreature:204#1501#teleportal}.

Feel the dark energy—the way it pulses? Eerie, isn't it?

That's the argon signature."Akasha has argons?"

Perhaps, or perhaps the argons have Akasha. Doesn't matter.

The argons are only one of our problems. She's got gates locking everything down, and the key is the life-force of her most horrid creations.

Turion, her champion of pestilence, binds the first gate. Adanok, her most blood-thirsty servant, guards the second. Get moving. I'll scry ahead to find our next obstacles.

There are few soldiers of your caliber, but don't get cocky. We've got to get past Nadaim, the Champion of Plague, to open the third gate. Then we'll visit an old friend—Karascha!<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Karascha? The demon from the Island of Dawn?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Indeed. That fiend nearly did me in.

If Akasha chose to resurrect Karascha...maybe she knew we'd come here. It's almost like she's taunting us.

It doesn't matter. We've quite a gauntlet ahead of us.

Feel that energy? So much stronger here than at the entrance. This must be the teleportal that takes us to Akasha!

Let's hope it's not a one-way trip, eh?
